titlestmt.titleproper: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Development Office records 1967-1997
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Development Office records

bioghist.p: The Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia was founded in 1812 "for the encouragement and cultivation of the sciences, and the advancement of useful learning." The work of the Academy is funded by grants and contracts, state appropriations, contributions, bequests, endowments, museum admissions and museum shop income. The Development Department works to acquire funding for the Academy through grants, donations, and special events.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records from the Academy's Development Department, including records of Honor Fox, Ray Slater, Louis Sage, and Cynthia Jones Eiseman. Materials include: correspondence, grant proposals and reports, appeal letters, records related to city and state appropriations, Development Committee minutes, strategic planning documents, monthly activity reports (1986-1989), and printed promotional materials for the Academy. Also includes diskettes of files kept by Honor Fox, audio cassettes of radio spots for Discovering Dinosaurs, slides of educational programs, and a video of the 180th Annual Meeting.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
